document.masterDocTitle: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Pamphagidae (Orthoptera: Acridoidea) from the Palaearctic Region: taxonomy, classification, keys to genera and a review of the tribe Nocarodeini I. Bolívar

subSubSection.paragraph:

in lit.: sensu Fischer von Waldheim 1846: 269.

: in Fischer von Waldheim 1846: 269.

cyanipes Fisch. W.
: I. Bolívar 1878a : 439, under the genus
Nocarodes
.

subSubSection.paragraph: Type locality . Armenia (Fischer von Waldheim 1846: 269). Holotype: female (Unspecified host).

Material examined.

Nocaracris cyanipes ornatus
), 1♀ ( Allotype of
Nocaracris cyanipes ornatus
), 2♀ ( Paratypes of
Nocaracris cyanipes ornatus
) ( ZIN )
;

Distribution. Widely distributed in Caucasia and Transcaucasia:
Georgia
, Armenia , Russia , Daghestan , N.W. Iran ,
Azerbaijan
, Nakhichevan , N.E. Turkey : Artvin , Ardahan , Ağrı provinces ( Fig. 845 ).

Remarks. The author of this species must be Motschultsky (in Fischer de Waldheim 1846: 269) in the case of
Nocaracris rubripes
(see the Remarks section of
N. rubripes
above), but all subsequent researchers gave the author of this species as Fischer von Waldheim except Fieber (1853: 127) .

Ramme (1951) in describing the subspecies
N. cyanipes ornatus
and
N. cyanipes tristis
distinguished them from the nominotypical taxon only by the coloration of the integument. According to Ramme (1951: 298) morphology of these two taxa is “as the nominotypical subspecies”. The hind leg colors are also the same. The coloration and pattern of the integument cannot be diagnostic characters in this species, as well as most other species of Pamphagidae . I agree with Avakyan (1968: 100) who synonymized
Nocaracris cyanipes ornatus Ramme
with
N. cyanipes
for the first time, but it was overlooked by subsequent authors. I also propose
Nocaracris cyanipes tristis Ramme, 1951
as a synonym of this species here.

Motschultsky (in Fischer von Waldheim 1846: 269) in describing this species after the female recorded the color of hind leg as greyish-blue. According to Uvarov (1928: 150) the inner side of hind tibia is black or blueblack in both sexes. Subsequent authors gave it as that of the original description and as in Uvarov (1928) , but in the rich material of the ZIN the coloration of hind tibia variable from black, dark blue to dark red in both sexes.

Weidner (1962: 88) mentioned the presence of
N. cyanipes
in N. Iraq and stated that previous identified specimens belong to a
Nocarodes
species not yet described. In my opinion the presence of
N. cyanipes
in Iraq is not likely. The previous records may refer to a
Paranothrotes
species or more likely another
Nocaracris
species.

This species was recorded by Uvarov (1918) from Urmia; Ihsan & Donskoff (1988) from the Middle East (Syria); by
Çıplak et al. (1996)
from Malatya Province of Turkey; by Satar & Özbay (2003) from Diyarbakır Province of Turkey; by
Jabbari et al. (2015)
from Khorasan, E. Iran. It is not so likely to be in those regions, thus they should deserve to be confirmed.
